byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Two University of Cincinnati police officers who were present when officer Ray Tensing shot and killed black motorist Samuel Dubose are put on paid leave; $1 million bail is set for Tensing, who is released on bond and faces murder charge.
lead_paragraph: A judge set bail of $1 million for the University of Cincinnati officer, Ray Tensing, while two other officers who were present during the killing were put on paid leave.

headline.main: Ex-Officer in Cincinnati Makes Bail in Killing of Motorist
headline.print_headline: Ex-Officer Makes Bail in Killing of Motorist

snippet: A judge set bail of $1 million for the University of Cincinnati officer, Ray Tensing, while two other officers who were present during the killing were put on paid leave.
